entry.title: Red Cross resumes medical evacuations from Karabakh

media:group.media:title: Red Cross resumes medical evacuations from Karabakh
media:group.media:description:
üìçThe foreign ministers of Armenia and Azerbaijan will meet tomorrow in Washington for another round of negotiations. üìçAzerbaijan‚Äôs foreign minister said Baku rejects Yerevan‚Äôs insistence on including guarantees for Karabakh Armenians‚Äô rights and security in any future peace deal. üìçThe International Committee of the Red Cross resumed medical evacuations from Karabakh to Armenia after being prevented from doing so by Azerbaijan for more than a week.

entry.title: Made in Artsakh: Karabakh turns to local production amid blockade

media:group.media:title: Made in Artsakh: Karabakh turns to local production amid blockade
media:group.media:description:
Since the beginning of Azerbaijan‚Äôs blockade, which began over six months ago, many stores and local businesses in Nagorno-Karabakh have closed due to lack of supplies and the blockade‚Äôs economic impact. Today, stores that remain open sell mainly locally-produced goods such as pasta, dairy products and canned goods. Although it is difficult for local factories to operate amid the blockade, which has come with shortages in electricity and heating gas, some have turned to local production to mitigate the critical food shortages in the region.

entry.title: Russia Expands Key Border Crossing for Trade with Armenia: THIS WEEK IN BUSINESS

media:group.media:title: Russia Expands Key Border Crossing for Trade with Armenia: THIS WEEK IN BUSINESS
media:group.media:description:
üìçMoody‚Äôs, one of the ‚Äúbig three‚Äù rating agencies, upgraded Armenia‚Äôs credit outlook from ‚Äúnegative‚Äù to ‚Äústable,‚Äù while keeping the country‚Äôs credit rating at a non-investment-grade level. üìçA joint U.S.-Armenian venture vowed to move forward with plans to build a scrap metal plant in an Armenian border village despite repeated Azerbaijani shelling. üìçRussia completed a multimillion-dollar expansion of its sole border crossing with Georgia, a key transit point for Armenia‚Äôs trade with the outside world. üìçThe investigative outlet Hetq sued the Ministry of High-Tech Industry to access documents showing the government‚Äôs financial support for IT companies.

entry.title: Parliamentary Assembly of the Council of Europe calls on Azerbaijan to reopen Lachin corridor

media:group.media:title: Parliamentary Assembly of the Council of Europe calls on Azerbaijan to reopen Lachin corridor
media:group.media:description:
üìçAzerbaijani soldiers shelled Armenian positions in Artsakh, wounding an Armenian soldier and damaging a residential home. üìçAzerbaijani crews removed a cross from an Armenian church in the town of Berdzor, also known as Lachin, apparently in a bid to turn it into a mosque. Berdzor was handed over to Azerbaijan in the aftermath of the 2020 Karabakh War. üìçYerevan criticized Moscow for its response to last week‚Äôs violent clashes between Armenian and Azerbaijani forces near the Lachin corridor. üìçThe Parliamentary Assembly of the Council of Europe (PACE) called on Azerbaijan to restore energy and gas supplies to Artsakh and reopen the Lachin Corridor - the only overland route between Artsakh and Armenia.
